plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to southern Europe and Asia, known for its large clusters of bell-shaped flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Europe, parts of Asia
plants.funFact: Rhododendron ponticum can form dense thickets, sometimes outcompeting native plants in introduced areas like the UK.

plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A fragrant, tall lily with large white flowers, historically significant and often cultivated in gardens and religious settings.
plants.funFact: The Madonna Lily has been cultivated since ancient times and was considered a symbol of purity in Christian iconography.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An Australian native tree with striking golden-orange, spider-like flowers that bloom profusely and attract birds.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring (September to November in Australia) but blooms in May in Southern Hemisphere autumn climate zones
plants.location: Eastern Australia and cultivated in subtropical and tropical climates worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite the name, Silky Oak is not a true oak but belongs to the Proteaceae family.

plants.name: Ipomoea nil
plants.description: A fast-growing vine famous for its colorful trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the morning and close by afternoon.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early fall (May onward in Northern Hemisphere)
plants.location: Native to East Asia, widely cultivated as an ornamental worldwide
plants.funFact: Japanese Morning Glory seeds were popular in Edo-period Japan and traded extensively among enthusiasts.
